oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Soldier about to depart Vung Chua Mountain by truck
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A soldier sitting in the back of a truck about to leave Vung Chua Mountain, probably headed to Qui Nhon or to a patrol on the other side of the mountain. He wears sunglasses and a wristwatch and displays the signal brigade patch on his sleeve.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Military personnel; Soldiers; Uniforms; Military uniforms; Helmets; Trucks
United States. Army. Military Police Company, 194th; Vietnam War, 1961-1975; Vietnam; Qui Nhon (Vietnam)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ammons, Christopher D., 1948-
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Ammons has explained that soldiers on Vung Chua seldom wore helmets or uncomfortable flak vests on standard patrols. This expedition was either a special patrol across the bay (to lay seismic detectors) or a trip to Qui Nhon, both of which would have required soldiers to wear their full equipment.
